#summary IPTWeather installation steps.

  * *Prerequesite*:<br />
    * *Install* *<a href="http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=633618" target="_blank">tronikos' iPhoneToday</a>* and/or *<a href="http://s2u2.ac-s2.com/" target="_blank">S2U2</a>*<br />
    * *Install <a href="http://www.sto-helit.de/index.php?module=download&amp;action=view&amp;entry=65" target="_blank">Mortscript <b>4.2</b></a>*<br />
    * Optionnaly, to use the 'My Location' feature, install <a href="http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=607102" target="_blank">Sleuth's myLocation Service</a><br />
    * *Install the latest IPTWeather* cab file provided <a href="http://code.google.com/p/iptweather/downloads/list" target="_blank">here</a>. (the configuration at installation is the one I use with S2U2 and iPhoneToday with the current weather icon displayed in place of the top left icon on the first page)<br />
===*IMPORTANT*: all IPTWeather settings listed below (and many others) can be set by runinng the *'ITPWeather Config'* shortcut from the *Start Menu*, or by editing the <a href="http://code.google.com/p/iptweather/wiki/Configuration" target="_blank">weather.ini file</a>. More information can be found in the <a href="http://code.google.com/p/iptweather/wiki/FAQ" target="_blank">FAQ</a>.===
  * *To use IPTWeather in iPhoneToday*:<br />
    * extract an icon set (<a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/accuweathericons.zip" target="_blank">accuweathericons.zip</a> or <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/spilicons.zip" target="_blank">spilicons.zip</a> or from other users) to any folder and change *`IPTWaccuWeatherIconPath`* in the *`User settings`* to point to this folder.<br />
    * launch iPhoneToday, and configure/edit the first icon on the first page (or change *`IPTWcurrentWeatherIcon`* and *`IPTWcurrentWeatherPage`* in the *`User settings`*) by setting the 'Execute' field to call the script *iPhoneTodayAccuWeather.mscr*. This icon will show the current weather.<br />
  * *To use IPTWeather in S2U2 wallpaper*:
    * extract <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/AccuWeatherHD_20100420.zip" target="_blank">AccuWeatherHD.zip</a> (or <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/S2U2wallpaper_20100421.zip" target="_blank">S2U2wallpapers.zip</a> or <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/howdykeith_Accuw%20Lands%20icons_by_Michoob.zip" target="_blank">howdykeith's Accuw Lands icons</a>) to any folder and change *`IPTWS2U2WallpaperPath`* in the *`S2U2 settings`* to point to this folder.<br />
  * *To use IPTWeather with S2U2 UserWeather* (bottom left weather icon in S2U2):
    * extract <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/S2U2icons.zip" target="_blank">S2U2icons.zip</a> (or <a href="http://iptweather.googlecode.com/files/S2U2spilicons.zip" traget="_blank">S2U2spilicons.zip</a>) into your *`\Program files\S2U2\gfx`* folder (or in another folder defined by *`IPTWS2U2UserWeatherIconsPath`* in the *`S2U2 settings`*).<br />
  * *Configure ITPWeather by running the 'IPTWeather Config' shortcut in the Start Menu* (or by editing the <a href="http://code.google.com/p/iptweather/wiki/Configuration" target="_blank">weather.ini file</a>).<br />
  * *Restart* your phone or just run startAccuWeather.mscr so the next update will be scheduled in *`IPTWdelayHours`* and *`IPTWdelayMinutes`* in the *`User settings`*. If you want to update just after the installation, just connect to Wifi and run the script getAccuWeather.mscr which will update the weather.<br />

*For more information on how to use/configure IPTWeather, please check the <a href="http://code.google.com/p/iptweather/wiki/FAQ" target="_blank">FAQ</a>.*
